text: hi I'm dr. Michio Kaku from sci-fi
science on science channel you know some
of the biggest secrets of science were
unlocked by pen and paper sometimes even
on the back of an envelope but to solve
some of the really big mysteries
sometimes you need a really big
experiment like this one it's called the
Large Hadron Collider and it's the most
expensive and ambitious science project
ever do you know what one of its main
aims is is it to create dark matter to
blast a rocket to another galaxy or the
channel energy from the Earth's core the
answer is to create dark matter dark
matter appears to make up about
twenty-three percent of the mass and
energy of the universe problem is we've
never been able to catch any of it or
study it so the idea of the Large Hadron
Collider is to make some dark matter in
a controlled environment my prediction
one day they will discover dark matter
and when they do our understanding of
the universe will be changed forever
